title: Knowledge Management roles and permissions
content:
Different phases of knowledge management require different responsibilities. Depending on the size of the organization, some roles might be combined but the responsibilities remain the same.

Service Management uses role-based permissions to enable you to complete a task that's appropriate to your role. The tenant administrator manages and assigns these permissions.

By default, the roles assigned to Knowledge Management support creation, review, and publishing of knowledge articles, as well as the moderation of user questions:

Role Responsibilities
Knowledge Contributor
  • Creates and updates new knowledge articles, and moves articles through certain phases of the workflow process
  • Imports knowledge articles
  • Moderates questions and answers
  • Defines audiences for articles
Knowledge Publisher
  • Performs all of the responsibilities of a Knowledge Contributor
  • Publishes articles to the Service Portal
  • Removes articles from the Service Portal
  • Updates articles in the Service Portal
  • Defines new entitlement rules in the system, which can be used to define audiences for articles
Knowledge Administrator
  • Performs all of the responsibilities of a Knowledge Publisher
  • Configures the On-Premises Bridge to perform external knowledge indexing
  • Defines and configures the workflow process for knowledge articles

You can also create additional roles that have the relevant permissions for the Knowledge Administration module. For more information, see How to edit role permissions.

Review the individual permission assignments for each role in Administration > MasterÂ Data > People > Roles.

Specific permissions that are available for Knowledge Management are:

  • Import articles
  • Publish articles to the Service Portal
  • Update articles that are currently published in the Service Portal
  • Hide articles that are currently published in the Service Portal
  • Moderate user questions and answers
